intro: Orthocarpus erianthus var. laevis, commonly known as the smooth orthocarpus, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the familyApiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the Apiaceae family. This variety is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas.
